{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3569775,"name":null,"username":"team-5438","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/4da419/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T02:52:31.402Z","cooked":"

Hi everyone,

We’re trying to get pose estimation set up so that we can auto-align with the reef. We’re using YAGSL for swerve and the example subsystems that come with it (and Photonvision for vision). Our cameras are two OV9821’s running on an OrangePi 5 Pro. Essentially, we can get pose via odometry, and we can get pose via the cameras, but something is not working when they should be combining. You can see our code here (the subsystems in question are SwerveSubsystem and Vision): https://github.com/team-5438/2025EarlySeason/tree/visionTest/src/main/java/frc/robot

By printing out the values given in the updatePoseEstimation() method in the Vision subsystem, we can see that the cameras are correctly estimating a pose based off of april tags. However, if we run swerveDrive.getPose(), we only get the pose given by our drivetrain odometry. Additionally, if we run a driveToPose() command, it drives to the pose given by swerveDrive.getPose().

Has anyone else had this issue?
Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-27T02:52:31.402Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":140,"readers_count":139,"score":83.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497095,"topic_slug":"pose-estimation-not-correctly-combining-the-pose-from-vision-with-pose-from-odometry","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/team-5438/2025EarlySeason/tree/visionTest/src/main/java/frc/robot","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"2025EarlySeason/src/main/java/frc/robot at visionTest · team-5438/2025EarlySeason · GitHub","clicks":14}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":72148,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pose-estimation-not-correctly-combining-the-pose-from-vision-with-pose-from-odometry/497095/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3569797,"name":"Paul Rensing","username":"prensing","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/prensing/{size}/65820_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T03:17:32.617Z","cooked":"

I have not looked in details, but the code looks sensible. What I did notice is that the std deviations you put on the cameras is huge, specifically 4m for a single tag. That is probably making estimator effectively ignore the vision measurements.

Try turning it down, maybe overly low, and see if that gets it working.

Check that your timestamps are reasonable. We had to work on our latency adjustment code a bit to get all the timestamps to be compatible.

Hello, our team plans to use limelight3 for full field positioning. Should the time stamp of visual measurement subtract the operation delay of limelight itself from the startup time of roboreo program or subtract the operation delay from the startup time of limelight?
